Clip.Title: AERIAL AMERICA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From its Great Lakes to its Grand Canyon, its Rocky Mountain peaks to its Key West reefs, America is a land of amazing destinations. This aerial adventure over the nation's most remarkable landscapes and landmarks captures the breathtaking beauty of America, while demonstrating how its sense of wonder has inspired countless artists, thinkers, and revolutionaries.

Clip.Title: SPACE VOYAGES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: NASA is sizing up a new but familiar challenge: how to transport humans back into deep space - to the moon, to Mars, to asteroids, and beyond. New destinations require new hardware - more powerful rockets and radical new landing modules. Venture back to our early space adventures with Buzz Aldrin, Jim Lovell and NASA experts and learn about the successes and failures of the Apollo missions. Follow today's technicians as they reach for the stars by learning from these lessons of the past.

Clip.Title: WARSHIPS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Ride along with a Canadian fleet of Warships as they patrol the Persian Gulf.

Clip.EpisodeSummary: Ride along with a Canadian fleet of Warships as they patrol the Persian Gulf.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From Canada's easternmost point to Europe's westernmost point, this aerial survey explores the Atlantic coastline, from the wonders of St. John's Newfoundland and the Avalon peninsula - to the unique islands of St. Pierre and Miquelon.

Clip.Title: ALL ABOARD
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Emmanuelle boards the Langkawi Express, a 750km ride from South to North Malaysia.

Clip.Title: CORSICA: THE PEARL OF THE MEDITERRANEAN
Clip.EpisodeSummary: This series takes us on a journey to discover the island's history, its culture and its proud people.

Clip.Title: HIMALAYA: PATH TO THE SKY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Follow the life of an 8 year old Tibetan boy believed to be the reincarnation of a passed Monk.

Clip.Title: SKY VIEW
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Soar over Europe and experience the landscape from an eagle's perspective. This remarkable series uses the latest HD and camera mount technology to give the audience a view of Europe and its history that will takes their breath away.

Clip.Title: SKY VIEW
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Soar over Europe and experience the landscape from an eagle's perspective. This remarkable series uses the latest HD and camera mount technology to give the audience a view of Europe and its history that will takes their breath away.

Clip.Title: THE HISTORY OF THE FUTURE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: As technology advances, discover why we must respect Mother Nature as the ultimate power on this planet.

Clip.Title: THE HISTORY OF THE FUTURE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Inquire as to whether the idea of a perfect society is, indeed, possible.

Clip.Title: SERIOUSLY AMAZING OBJECTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Lindbergh's Spirit of St. Louis, Irving Berlin's piano, and Seinfeld's puffy shirt. These are just some of the many items flown, touched, played, and worn by American icons, whose great success stories can be found at the Smithsonian. Join us as we give lucky museum goers a chance to get close to some Seriously Amazing Objects. Many of these treasures are locked deep in the vaults and are not always on public display...until now.

Clip.Title: RUTKA - A DIARY OF A HOLOCAUST
Clip.Episode: Rutka - A Diary of The Holocaust
Clip.EpisodeSummary: An Israeli woman discovers she had a half sister killed in the Holocaust. Upon finding her diary, she retraces her steps from her life in the Ghetto to her tragic end at Auschwitz.

Clip.Title: U455 - THE MYSTERY OF THE LOST SUBMARINE
Clip.Episode: U455 - The Mystery of the Lost Submarine
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In summer 2008, a mysterious submarine was discovered off the coast of Italy at 120 meters deep. For Lorenzo del Veneziano, an underwater marine archeologist, it was an amazing sight, as the submarine was intact! Could this be the wreck of the long lost U-455, the last missing German U-boat from World War II?
